results.name: Number of iterations until n reaches 1 or 4 under x goes to sum of squares of digits map.
reference: J. Roberts, Lure of the Integers, Math. Assoc. America, 1992, p. 13.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..1000 from Harvey P. Dale)
A. Porges, A set of eight numbers, Amer. Math. Monthly, 52 (1945), 379-382. [Annotated scanned copy]
Arthur Porges, A set of eight numbers, Amer. Math. Monthly 52 (1945), 379-382.
formula: a(n) = 0 if n = 1 or 4, otherwise a(n) = 1 + a(A003132(n)). - _Robert Israel_, Apr 11 2019
maple: if n = 1 or n = 4 then 0 else 1 + procname(f(n)) fi
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Mira Bernstein_
